Closing in favor of #2701
Oops, I just saw @ewencp's comment.  dotVersion sounds like the right thing, I just pushed a patch for that.
@gwenshap Fair point, updated as suggested.
By the way, I'm not even sure we can automate promotion. Some bits of it probably, but when I did it, it was a pretty annoying back and forth getting PMC members to do some of the steps.

Ugh.  Got this again:
```
kafka.integration.SaslSslTopicMetadataTest > testAliveBrokersListWithNoTopicsAfterNewBrokerStartup FAILED
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not find a 'KafkaServer' or 'sasl_ssl.KafkaServer' entry in the JAAS configuration. System property 'java.security.auth.login.config' is /tmp/kafka160679235397629849.tmp
```
Looks like KAFKA-4075?
restest this please

Got a flaky test.  Looks like KAFKA-4801
```
kafka.api.ConsumerBounceTest > testConsumptionWithBrokerFailures FAILED
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.CommitFailedException: Commit cannot be completed since the group has already rebalanced and assigned the partitions to another member. This means that the time between subsequent calls to poll() was longer than the configured max.poll.interval.ms, which typically implies that the poll loop is spending too much time message processing. You can address this either by increasing the session timeout or by reducing the maximum size of batches returned in poll() with max.poll.records.
```
retest this please

@guozhangwang @hachikuji @apurvam @ijuma - i've done the broker side changes, though only managed to test one of them as the only way to test seems to be via end-to-end tests requiring the client. 
So.. trying to implement the changes in the KafkaProducer. I'm not sure how to handle the errors when they are coming back on the `Sender` thread. For example, when we do a `producer.send(..)` and it adds a new partition we send the `AddPartitionsToTxnRequest`, if this fails with `Errors.TRANSACTIONAL_ID_AUTHORIZATION_FAILED` i  call `fatal(errror.exception())` which marks the transaction manager as having an error, but this doesn't stop any subsequent requests in the `Sender` from being processed. So despite that the `AddPartitionsToTxnRequest` it still tries to produce to the partition. 
How are we supposed to handle this and propagate the errors back to the user? If a request like `AddPartitionstoTxnRequest` fails should it also error out any related `ProduceRequests`?
Anyway, i need some help here as i'm going around in circles.
